intro: Swainsona oroboides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that are often followed by elongated seed pods. It is adapted to grow in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Swainsona oroboides is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it an important plant in ecological restoration efforts.
